<h1 align="center">
  Shopa
</h1>

Shopa is front end piece built with Gatsby. It features a landing page that strike the attention of users on their first visit to the site. Good for merchandise site.

_Want to know more about 'Gatsby'? Check out the docs collection @ [Gatsby](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/)._

## ðŸš€ Quick start

1.  **Clone the repo.**


    ```shell
    # get the project on your local machine by running this in the cli
    git clone repo
    ```

1. **Navigate into the new directory.**

    ```shell
    cd repo_name
    ```

1.  **Install dependencies.**

    Navigate into your new siteâ€™s directory and start it up.

    ```shell
    npm install
    gatsby develop
    ```

1.  **Open and start editing!**

    The site should be running at `http://localhost:8000`!

    _Note: You'll also see a second link: _`http://localhost:8000/___graphql`_. This is a tool you can use to experiment with querying your data. Learn more about using this tool in the [Gatsby tutorial](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/tutorial/part-five/#introducing-graphiql)._
